page.title: 18Halcombe Farm
page.content: The farm is situated near Piddinghoe in the Ouse valley. It was originally called Horecumbe. Its main source of income are 4 large poultry units each holding 25,000 hens. The hens are kept in small cages .This style of chicken farming is called battery farming. The cages are in long rows with mechanical feeders. A conveyor belt gives automatic egg collection. The cages are only cleaned out once a year and the refuse is then sold to Lower Hodden farm as fertiliser. Each hen produce an average of 360 eggs durings 18 month laying life . Recently 100,000 pounds was spent on modernisation. The farmer raises pheasants and honey from bee hives. He also grows corn and barley to sell. The farmers workers horses are kept in the paddocks.
